oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Social sustainability of alternative food systems viewed through actor argumentation
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Nousiainen, Marko
Pylkkänen, Päivi
Vesala, Kari Mikko
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Policy environments and social economy
Markets and trade
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The method of the study was qualitative attitude research, which is based on the generation and analysis of argumentation. The material was produced by presenting selected statements concerning different aspects of social sustainability to the interviewees, asking them to comment on the statements. The attitudes towards alternative food systems were generally positive. The local and organic food production were seen more ecological, better for the economy of rural communities and more fair towards the farmer.
